main event: Two extremely bright, star-like objects were observed moving at high speed in the sky over Xenia, Ohio on October 7, 1958.
interesting points: The objects were brighter than stars and had a blue cast, flashing together,They were estimated to be about the size of a nickel held at arm's length,The sighting lasted approximately 2 minutes,One observer and their spouse reported seeing the objects,It was speculated that the objects could have been aircraft testing anti-collision lights.
sighted object: two pinpoint lights in the sky
